result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with the co-actor.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until 07-24-2015 at 12:00 PM.  The first 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, school, or treatment purposes only.  Court ordered GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT to apply towards the condition time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Augusta S.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS. 
Credit given for 6 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED until 07-24-2015 at 12:00 PM.  The first 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, school, or treatment purposes only.  Court ordered GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT to apply towards the condition time.
* No contact with the victim.
* No contact with the co-actor.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing Referral Form.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant, Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith, appeared in court with Attorney Jeff Schwarz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared on behalf of the State.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation Report; received and filed.

Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Ron Dague for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/21/15.
css
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.S. and Andre Moore.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Alonso Shamar Lowe-Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant advised the he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if certain conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
